content.description:
General  Great climbing in a friendly environment.  I've heard from many out of state visiting climbers that this is one of the cleanest gyms in the country, especially since we got rid of the wood chips and put in a padded carpeted floor. 

  Phone number  816-228-9988      

  Parking - abundant 

  Hours  M-F 2-10; Sat 10-6; Sun 12-6 

  Height of Wall  about 35 ft TR and Lead area, about 12 ft bouldering area 

  Size of Wall  6800 sq ft. 

  Range of difficulty  5.5-5.13 

  Number of routes  usually about 40-50, plus bouldering problems 

  Type of Wall  texture painted plywood, with features such as flakes and aretes 

  Leading  yes, must take lead class or test out 

  Bouldering  yes 

  Other training options  campus board, campus ladder 

  Other bonuses   

  Age limitations  any can climb with a waiver, but under 18 MUST have a GUARDIAN sign IN PERSON or with a notary 

  Requirements to certify  TR belay: 13 years old and $25, includes whole day climbing; Lead class: be solid on 5.9 and working 5.10, usually offered one Thursday per month 

  Rental equipment  Shoes: $4; Harness: $3; Shoes and Harness: $6; Chalk: $2  

  Hidden costs  None 

  Hidden savings  Thursday is LADIES NIGHT; There is also usually a coupon in the phone book. 

  Daily costs - Belay Safety Class for 1st timers: $25; Day entry: $13; Just Bouldering: $10; Kids Entry (12 and under): $10; Kids Bouldering: $8 

  Punch cards  5 visit: $55; 5 visit with gear: $70; 10 visit: $95; 10 visit with gear: $125; 10 visit bouldering: $80 

  Memberships  Month: $65; 3 month: $170; 6 month: 260; 1 year: $450 

  Classes  Technique 1, Technique 2, Leading, Private Lessons 

  Competitions  yes 

  Other - Adult parties, After-hour parties, Team building, Birthday parties, Boy scout overnight and merit badge
